meanings.definition: A writ summoning persons to court as jurors.
meanings.sent1: The judge issued a venires to gather potential jurors for the trial.
meanings.sent2: The venires included people from various backgrounds to form a fair jury.
meanings.sent3: The venires walked into the courtroom, looking slightly confused but ready to serve.
meanings.sent4: The venires were like puzzle pieces, each one essential to complete the jury panel.
meanings.sent5: The venires were the key players in the legal drama unfolding in the courthouse.

meanings.definition: A group of persons summoned for jury duty.
meanings.sent1: The venires assembled in the jury room, waiting for the trial to begin.
meanings.sent2: Each member of the venires had a role to play in the justice system.
meanings.sent3: The venires chatted nervously, wondering what case they would be assigned to.
meanings.sent4: The venires stood together, a united front in the pursuit of justice.
meanings.sent5: The venires were the backbone of the legal process, ensuring a fair trial for all.
